title.narrative: Institutional support to National Farmer Federation in Macedonia

description.narrative: Project aims at strengthening the National Federaton of Farmers (NFF) as an active organisation representing and acting as voice of their members and providing quality services to their members, with strong emphasis on gender equality, poverty and human rights in rural areas in Macedonia. Expected results are - Strengthened organisational capacity, accountability and strategic direction; - NFF has improved financial and administrative systems; - NFF is known as promoter of gender equality and HRBA in rural development; - Increased information and education among farmers in Macedonia and the Region; - Cooperative model and other forms of farmer economic organisations are promoted; - The work on social and economic inclusion of focus groups for small-scale farmers, minorities and youth is increased; - Improved capacity of the organisation to lobby and advocate on local and national level based on HRBA; Developed lobby and advocacy initiatives for climate change, subsidies system and contract farming; - Strengthen the strategic focus on Gender Equality within Sustainable Rural Development; - Partners facilitate access to financial services and access to land for women; - Increased number of women on leadership position in the management and membership of the organisation.

"• The We Effect' Partner Federation of the Farmers of the Republic of Macedonia has successfully finalized the comprehensive transformation process. The organisation is rebranded and officially register under the new name National Federation of Farmers - NFF. • in the component for organisational development, the National Federation of Farmers (NFF) has undertaken all the necessary activities according to the Action Plan 2018 to establish the needed procedures and implement the activities to improve the democratic capacity, professionalism and transparency of the organisation. The well-functioning Management Board and General Assembly as well as of the sub-sector groups and other specific committees in relation to different initiatives and projects, has resulted in an increased number of members in the decision-making processes and raised the feeling of loyalty and recognition both by the members and cooperating partners. • NFF has organised the annual assembly in a very transparent way, resulting in high presence of delegates from all the regions (63 delegates, 27 women and 36 men). • NFF has succeeded to intensify the cooperation with the Ministry of Agriculture in the area of lobbying in the interest of agricultural development through the sub sector groups that are part in Law of agriculture and rural development. • Around 27 announcements in the media were published for the General Assembly emphasizing that marketing as the main problem in agriculture and the request to convene the Council for Agriculture and Rural Development. • In collaboration with the other We Effect partner in Macedonia, Rural Development Network Macedonia, NFF organised the celebration of the International day of Rural Women on 15 October 2018. More than 140 participants, including women farmers, representatives from local self-governments, civil society and experts working in the area of rural development and empowerment of women, gathered for a public debate on “The role of women in rural areas and their challenges”. A Declaration for improving the social and economic position of women in rural areas was signed by the National Federation of Farmers (NFF), the Rural Development Network Macedonia (RDN of RM), the Ministry of Labour and Social Policy and the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy. This declaration marks a turning point for rural women in Macedonia. • Through the support of We Effect, NFF submitted a shadow report on the existing challenges for rural women in the Republic of Macedonia with concrete recommendations, to the UN Committee on the Elimination of the Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW). The report was presented and discussed at the 71 session of CEDAW in Geneva. The representatives of We Effect and NFF attended the session of CEDAW. "
